subject: Sleep
title: How Ancient Egyptians Slept
description: A micro-lesson that makes How Ancient Egyptians Slept usable.

hook.text: Ancient Egyptians slept on stone headrests instead of pillows. Comfort wasn't the priority. Hair preservation was.

buildup.text: Elaborate wigs and hairstyles took hours to create. Stone headrests kept them intact through the night.

discovery.text: Wealthy Egyptians had raised beds with woven rope supports, elevating them from scorpions and snakes on the floor.

twist.text: They believed sleep was a nightly journey to the realm of the dead, making beds sacred ritual objects.

climax.text: Beds were placed in tombs for the afterlife. King Tut's tomb contained six gilded beds for eternal rest.

punchline.text: Egyptians planned their sleep for this life and the next.

quiz.question: Why did ancient Egyptians use stone headrests?
options: Stone was the only material available
To preserve elaborate hairstyles and wigs while sleeping
